metadata.title: CVE-2018-20762 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
GPAC version 0.7.1 and earlier has a buffer overflow vulnerability in thecat_multiple_files function in applications/mp4box/fileimport.c when MP4Boxis used for a local directory containing crafted filenames.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20762` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpac - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-3ubuntu0.1
gpac-modules-base - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-3ubuntu0.1
libgpac4 - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gpac package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-3ubuntu0.1').
